result.execSummary:
The defendant Cody W Gillis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Schedule I, II Narcotics [Modifiers: Conspiracy to Commit], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(a).
  • Manufacture/Deliver Cocaine (<=1g) [Modifiers: Conspiracy to Commit], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)1g.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay $250 fine plus costs. Pay supervision fees as ordered by Dept. of Corrections. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol. Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only take in the amount and frequency prescribed.
Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment.
Obtain AODA assessment and comply with treatment recommendations.

timeConds.notes: Huber privileges granted. 60 days to report. Can be served in any county. Defendant is responsible for notifying Door County Jail if sentence is being served in different county.

records.addlTxt: for Sentence Modification - Defendant requesting good time. Per Court, denied. No good time was granted at sentencing on his conditional jail time.
for Sentence Modification - Defendant requesting furlough. Per Court, denied. 2nd request in 8 days since sentencing.
for Sentence Modification - Defendant requesting rehab instead of jail. Per Court, denied. Have P.O. send a letter with the request/suggestion.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Defendant Cody W Gillis in court with attorney Brett E Reetz. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, elements. Defendant enters no contest pleas to Counts 1, 2. Court questions Defendant on rights, finds pleas made freely and voluntarily, accepts pleas, and finds Defendant guilty of Counts 1, 2. Count 3 is dismissed but read in for sentencing. Court reviews collateral consequences of felony conviction, possible penalties. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendations. Bond no longer in effect.

Defendant Cody W Gillis in court with attorney Brett E Reetz. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises that matter is resolved, will be requesting that he be allowed to serve time in different county, need to work out logistics of transport from jail to job, requests plea hearing in 2-3 weeks.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 16, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Cody W Gillis in court with attorney Brett E Reetz. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense waives reading of Information, enters not guilty pleas.  Status conference scheduled for October 22, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Cody W Gillis in court with attorney Brett E Reetz. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises that Defendant will waive prelim. Court questions Defendant, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds Defendant over for trial.  Arraignment scheduled for August 20, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Court appoints Brett Reetz, orders Defendant to pay $40 per pay period via wage assignment.
records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Defendant Cody W Gillis in court. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews charge, max. penalties, right to counsel, right to prelim. Court reviews Petition for Appointment of Counsel, appoints Atty Reetz, orders Defendant to pay $40 per pay period via wage assignment.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 27, 2015 at 10:00 am.

No contact direct or indirect with SL. Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only take in the amount and frequency prescribed. Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol.  Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia. To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving Justice Center.

Defendant Cody W Gillis in court. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, right to counsel, right to prelim. Court questions Defendant on what he wants to do about an attorney. Defendant wants Court-appointed Counsel. Petition given to Defendant with instructions.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 13, 2015 at 10:00 am.
